section.title: ReportFile
section.para: This was created using the $MONTH$ $DATE$, $YEAR$ build of GMAT.

section.title: Overview
section.para: The Report Object is a file where values and qualities of objects can be stored so that they can be viewed at a later time.

info.title: Figure: Default Name and Settings for the Report Object Dialog Box

caption.para: Figure: Default Name and Settings for the Report Object Dialog Box

entry.para: The FileName field allows the user to define the file path and file name for a report.
The Precision field allows the user to set the precision of thevariable written to a report.
Units: Same as variable being reported.
Options: [Any user-defined parameter. Ex.Variables, Arrays, S/C parameters]

: The \st{Add} field allows a userto add user-defined variables to a report file. To add multipleuser-defined variables, enclose the variables with curly brackets.Ex. MyReportName.Add ={Sat.X, Sat.Y, Var1, Array(1,1)}; TheGUI's Selected field is the equivalent of the script's Add field.In the event of no Add command or no objects in the Selected field, GMATshould run without the Report output and a warning message displayed in the message window. Thefollowing warning message is sufficient: Report plot will be turned off. No object has beenselected for reporting.
: The WriteReport field specifies whether to write data tothe report FileName.
: The WriteHeaders field specifies whether to includeheaders that describe the variables in a report.

tbody.row:
LeftJustify \
Default: On.
Options: [On, Off]:
When the LeftJustify field is set to On, then the data isleft justified and appears at the left most side of the column. Ifthe LeftJustify field is set to Off, then the data iscentered in the column.
Units: N/A.

entry.para: The ColumnWidth field is used to define the width of the datacolumns in a report file. The value for ColumnWidth is appliedto all columns of data. For example, if ColumnWidth is set to20, then each data column will be 20 white-spaces wide.

The SolverIterations field determines whether or not data associated with perturbed trajectories during a solver (Targeter, Optimize) sequence is written to a report file. When SolverIterations is set to On, solver iterations are written to the report file. When SolverIterations is Off, the solver iterations are not written to the report file.

listitem.para: Located in the mission tree and will retrieve values at that particular time and insert them at the bottom of the report file.
